I got to play this game for the first time a few weeks ago, and let me tell you, it was one of my favorite game experiences I have ever had. It is such a huge step up from the first Portal it's insane. The visuals still hold up 11 years later, and the gameplay and story are timeless. The writing is fantastic, has amazing humor but also knows when to take itself seriously. Of course the world building and subtle game design are top-notch. As a chemist I even found something in one of the areas that I haven't seen anyone talk about! It's the little things like that that make this game amazing. I beat the game over two days while streaming it on discord to some friends. The amount of times one of the people (a Portal 2 veteran) was facepalming at my stupidity as I struggled with some of the puzzles was hilarious. I would recommend you play the first Portal if you haven't already before this game, but even if you don't you will still have a fantastic time. 

TLDR: 11/10 amazing game. Would play for the first time all over again if I could.

Honestly the best game of 2011, maybe every to be honest.If you haven't played it I highly recommend you player it, make sure you play portal 1, however if you dont want to play them both, go watch p1 on yt, but the story had me in fucking tears that shit so good it beats lean, the speed runs to mwa. the community is so good (Only cuz you cant make r34 of any of the characters dont look it up) the people yourl meet you whole mind will change forever, add me and ill buy you the game its the fucking good

There is debate if video games can be considered art. This game proves in my mind that, yes- they can. 

Portal 2 (and the portal series) revolutionized gaming, with captivating puzzles, excellent story and world building, that make you ask, and simultaneously answer so many questions. This game has such charm and perfect humor, and it is balanced with the bleak pessimistic world and history you discover at aperture science. 
I assure you its worth so much more than the twelve~ dollars you will spend on it. 

This game really takes the *cake* ;)
Worthy successor to the venerable Portal.  Excellent puzzles that will open your brain to new ways of thinking.  Funny, too!

The potato is a starchy tuber of the plant Solanum tuberosum and is a root vegetable native to the Americas. The plant is a perennial in the nightshade family Solanaceae. In addition, you can put a potato on to your portal gun.
